question: Who was named the leading men’s cricketer of the year by 2020 Wisden Cricketers' Almanack?
explanation:
England all-rounder Ben Stokes has been recently named the \'Leading Cricketer in the World\' in the 2020 edition of the Wisden Cricketers\' Almanack. He becomes the first English cricketer to win the award since 2005 after Andrew Flintoff.
Ben Stokes replaced the Indian skipper Virat Kohli who had won the award three straight times till last year’s edition. Australian all-rounder Ellyse Perry won the leading woman player in the world award. England’s Jofra Archer, South Africa’s Simon Harmer, Australians Pat Cummins, Marnus Labuschagne and Ellyse Perry were named as the five Wisden Cricketers of the year.
